name: GET_DescribeBundleTasks
description:
Describes the specified bundle tasks or all of your bundle tasks.

Completed bundle tasks are listed for only a limited time. If your bundle task is no longer in the list, you can still register an AMI from it. Just use RegisterImage with the Amazon S3 bucket name and image manifest name you provided to the bundle task.

BundleId.description:
The bundle task IDs.

Default: Describes all your bundle tasks.

Filter.description:
The filters.

  • bundle-id - The ID of the bundle task.

  • error-code - If the task failed, the error code returned.

  • error-message - If the task failed, the error message returned.

  • instance-id - The ID of the instance.

  • progress - The level of task completion, as a percentage (for example, 20%).

  • s3-bucket - The Amazon S3 bucket to store the AMI.

  • s3-prefix - The beginning of the AMI name.

  • start-time - The time the task started (for example, 2013-09-15T17:15:20.000Z).

  • state - The state of the task (pending | waiting-for-shutdown | bundling | storing | cancelling | complete | failed).

  • update-time - The time of the most recent update for the task.

DryRun.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

allOf.description: The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values.

Filter.description:
A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs.

If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters.
